intro: Corispermum hyssopifolium f. virgatum, commonly known as the Virgin's thimble, is a rare and distinctive plant species characterized by its small, capsule-like fruits that resemble miniature thimbles. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually greenish or reddish in color, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. This subspecies is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
